thread.title: Facebook briefly blocks phrase 'everyone will know'
thread.title_full: Facebook briefly blocks phrase 'everyone will know'

title: Facebook briefly blocks phrase 'everyone will know'
text:
Facebook briefly blocks phrase 'everyone will know' Site says glitch was fixed Published On: Oct 12 2015 07:53:47 AM CDT Updated On: Oct 12 2015 09:32:55 AM CDT Tweet Nicholas Backus 
It's not as bad as a complete site outage, but it is a bit creepier, especially this close to Halloween. Related Content Dolphin retrieves iPhone from bottom of the ocean 
Reports of Facebook users not being able to post the phrase "everyone will know" surfaced last Friday and continued into the weekend until the social media site claimed it fixed the glitch, according to a Huffington Post report. 
Some users also reported receiving an error message saying that they had attempted to like a post, even though they claimed they were simply writing "everyone will know." 
A Facebook rep told HuffPo that the glitches were the result of updates to rules of Facebook's spam-fighting engine. 
Strange and ghostly messages on Facebook and other social media forums are a theme of the recently released-to-DVD horror film "Unfriended." Distributed by LAKANA. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
